intro: Callianthe scabrida, commonly known as the roughleaf daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are typically clustered in a head. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Callianthe scabrida is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens.
